installer.title: BatchExpert+
installer.description: Installer for ILS Automation's Batch Expert+

panel.title: ILS Automation Installer for Batch Expert+
panel.preamble: Welcome to the ILS Automation installer for Batch Expert+. The table below compares the existing installation of Batch Expert+, if any, with the versions contained in this new installation. Before continuing, please make sure that you have defined both database connection and tag provider.

panel.title: End User License Agreement (EULA)
panel.preamble: Click on the button below to view the license that specifies permissible use of the software to be installed. Select the checkbox to indicate acceptance of the terms. You must accept the license terms to proceed.

panel.title: Install Tags and UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs and tags for common BatchExpert controllers. These definitions are written to the default tag provider.

panel.title: Define tags provider and database connections
panel.preamble: Specify the database connection and DBMS-type that become the demonstration project defaults.

panel.title: Python Extensions for the Batch Expert+
panel.preamble: This page loads custom Python modules that support Batch Expert+.

panel.title: Batch-Expert Feature Selection
panel.preamble: Configure your Batch-Expert+ installation with (or without) optional features.

artifact.name: SFC
artifact.comment: Enable Sequential Functional Charts (SFCs) within Batch-Expert. Use of this feature requires the Ignition SFC module.

panel.title: Icons
panel.preamble: A small number of custom icons are used in Vision screens.

panel.title: Database Clear, Create and Alter Scripts Batch Expert+
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for populating the BEDB database instance specified on the 'definition' panel. The alter step is not required for a new installation. Likewise the drop and create steps should not be used for an existing installation. As a safety measure, the database creation step will fail unless any previous instance is explicitly cleared.

artifact.name: Drop Tables
artifact.comment: Clear the existing database of all tables, procedures and indices.

artifact.name: Create Tables
artifact.comment: Create tables and indices required for Batch Expert in the BE database.

artifact.name: Alter Tables
artifact.comment: Update table structures for the latest version of Batch Expert. No action is taken if the schema is current.

panel.title: Insert R1 Sample Data
panel.preamble: Insert results E1 into the production database. WARNING: Do not use in a "live" production system.

panel.title: Insert C1 Sample Data
panel.preamble: Insert results C1 into the production database. WARNING: Do not use in a "live" production system.

panel.title: Create alternative Scan Classes
panel.preamble: Create scanclasses referenced by application tags. Scanclasses determine tag poll rates.

panel.title: Install Custom Modules
panel.preamble: This step installs the ILS custom modules necessary for BatchExpert+.

panel.title: Install a New BE Project or Merge Changes into an Existing Project
panel.preamble: Batch Expert is the main Ignition project. This page provides artifacts for a clean, new installation or, alternatively, a merge with an existing version. A merge preserves any user modifications.

panel.title: Install SFC Charts in the Global Project
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of charts for sequential control of batch operations. The charts are packaged as Ignition global projects. They completely replace any existing charts of the same name. Multiple chart hierarchies can be updated from this one page.

panel.title: Installation Summary
panel.preamble: The list below shows which of the installation steps have been completed. Selecting "Finish" will record the current version of Batch Expert+ in the Gateway internal database.

epilog.title: Installation Complete
epilog.preamble: The automated installation and configuration of Batch Expert+ is complete. There are just a few more manual steps required.
epilog.note: Newly created projects are installed disabled. They must be enabled before use.
Several modules with active components have been installed. A Gateway restart is required.
